section.name: Accounting of sales returns.
section.p: Bob has sold on Jan 18 4 Pizza with bacon frozen and 4 Pizza with cheese frozen to Funny coffee shop. Bob has filled sales invoice (see Accounting of Sales.)

Bob was confirmed on Jan 19 what "Funny coffee shop" is bankrupt and he was received sales return 2 Pizza with bacon frozen and 2 Pizza with cheese frozen. Bob has printed full sales invoice report to figure price and cost which must be same for return:
Then Bob has filled sales return according sales invoice:

* Sales returns are business expenses (deducting income tax). If according the law of your country accrual method means that business expense occurs when you have received document (prove) even though you haven't received goods yet (in the same day), then (in this case) switch off method "SalesReturn, Debit SalesReturns.InvItemCategory Credit ReturnsPayable.DebtorCreditor" in accounting settings and make these deducting income accounting entries by hand.
